Offbeat Getaways From Pune On A Shoestring Budget

Tripotohttps://www.tripoto.com/
By Shalu Khandelwal
115.4k
VIEWS
145 Likes
Save
Share
Copy Link

Being a student, it is hard on your pocket to make extravagant travel plans. To escape with a few bucks, from my boring daily routine and to feed my urge to explore the road less travelled, I stumbled upon these offbeat places, which are a treat for your senses!

1. Rajmachi

Rajmachi

Photo Credit: Solarisgirl

Love trekking? Then this is the place for you. The beautiful place has exotic natural locations, covered in lush greenery along with several waterfalls and small streams.

Location: Midway between Khandala and Lonavala

Distance: 78 KmBest time to visit: September to March

2. Tamhini Ghat

Tamhini Ghat

It is difficult to describe in words the magnificent beauty of Tamhini Ghat. The breathtaking views of waterfalls and mountains will simply leave you awestruck!

SPONSORED

Photo Credit: Suyash Sonawane

Location: South western Maharashtra, near Krishna River

Distance: 112 KmBest time to visit: July to February

3. Panshet

Panshet

If you are looking to get away from the crowd, then Panshet is the right choice. The place is known for water activities. So, if you are planning for some adventure sport then get ready for jet skiing, kayaking and much more!

Photo Credit: Kiran Kulkarni

Location: Southwest of Pune

Distance: 50 KmBest time to visit: October To May

4. Sinhagad

Sinhagad Fort

If you are a history buff and want to know more about the glorious history of Pune, then Sinhagad Fort should be at the top of your bucket list.

SPONSORED

Photo Credit: Suryash Sonawane

Location: Southwest of Pune

Distance: 37 KmBest time to visit: July to February

5. Satara

Satara

Love photography? Then be prepared to fall in love with this place.

Photo Credit: Arindam Bhattacharya

Location: Located on National Highway

Distance: 112 Km Best time to visit: August to September

6. Lenyadri

Lenyadri Hill

Just one line – "Scenic view, Small Trek and Asthavinayak Darshan".A must visit place for Trekkers, Devotees and Nature Lovers.

Photo Credit: Vijay Yerzal

Location: Lekhan Hills, Junnar

Distance: 94 KmBest time to visit: February to December

So, stop wasting your time! Pack your bags and get ready to make this weekend memorable.

Frequent searches leading to this page:-
